organization: Citibank (US customers) via MphasiS Call Center (Pune)
attackMethod: Social engineering, unauthorized access, fraudulent account creation
rootCause: Insider threat, weak security controls, lack of monitoring of privileged access in the BPO environment
impact: Fraudulent transfers totaling approx. ₹1.9 crore (initial ₹1.5 crore + additional ₹38 lakh traced in 2005), substantial financial loss to Citibank and customers, reputational damage to the Indian BPO sector
description:
The MphasiS call center fraud, uncovered in April 2005, involved employees exploiting customer trust to extract PINs and personal details from US Citibank customers. Funds were transferred to bogus accounts in the US and then to India. Investigations revealed additional ₹38 lakh transferred in December 2004, bringing the total to ₹1.9 crore. Arrests followed, marking a pivotal case in India's BPO cybersecurity.

Key details:
- Actors: MphasiS employees (e.g., Ivan Thomas, Siddhartha Mehta, Stephen Daniel)
- Targets: Citibank US customer accounts
- Motivation: Financial gain
- Consequence: Arrests, enhanced BPO regulations

organization: National Association of Software and Service Companies (NASSCOM)
attackMethod: Fraudulent emails impersonating NASSCOM to extract personal data
rootCause: Misuse of email for headhunting, lack of specific anti-phishing legislation
impact: Potential data compromise for third parties, reputational harm to NASSCOM, legal precedent establishing phishing as illegal
description:
Defendants created fake emails and a website mimicking NASSCOM to solicit personal data (e.g., credit card details) for headhunting. The Delhi High Court ruled phishing illegal under passing off and tarnishment, granting injunctions and damages. This landmark judgment defined phishing under Indian law despite no specific statute.

Key details:
- Actors: Ajay Sood & Ors. (placement agency)
- Target: NASSCOM identity and third-party data
- Motivation: Data collection for recruitment
- Consequence: Injunction, damages, bolstered IP protection
